meanings.definition: A person or thing that entails.
meanings.sent1: The entailer of the situation was the lack of preparation.
meanings.sent2: The detective identified the entailer of the crime scene.
meanings.sent3: The entailer, a mischievous squirrel, stole all the nuts from the picnic.
meanings.sent4: Her contagious laughter was the entailer of joy in the room.
meanings.sent5: The entailer, a broken key, prevented the door from opening.

meanings.definition: To involve as a necessary circumstance or consequence.
meanings.sent1: His decision to skip class would entailer trouble with the teacher.
meanings.sent2: The heavy rain entailed canceling the outdoor event.
meanings.sent3: Trying to juggle too many tasks can entailer chaos in your schedule.
meanings.sent4: Lack of sleep can entailer a decrease in productivity at work.
meanings.sent5: Eating too much candy may entailer a stomachache later.
